question.qText: Which of the following does NOT explain Ottoman expansion shown on the map?

aBtn.aText: European states were tolerant regarding Islamic expansion into southeastern Europe.
The Holy Roman Empire was preoccupied with religious wars against Protestants.
The Italian city-states had weakened considerably by the mid-16th century.
European states were unable to pose a united front against Ottoman expansion.
Religious toleration within Ottoman-conquered territories limited anti-Turkish rebellions.
